thread.title: How to Cover Acne With Makeup - 'The Beauty Boy' Vlogger Jake-Jamie Ward Conceals Pimples
thread.title_full: How to Cover Acne With Makeup - 'The Beauty Boy' Vlogger Jake-Jamie Ward Conceals Pimples

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: How to Cover Acne With Makeup - 'The Beauty Boy' Vlogger Jake-Jamie Ward Conceals Pimples
text:
Jake-Jamie Ward , aka "The Beauty Boy" on YouTube, has made it his mission to shake up society's stereotypical view of makeup ‚Äî and he's doing just that. With his flawless foundation tutorials that he shares with his 16,000 subscribers on YouTube and 13,000 followers on Instagram, Ward not only started the #MakeupIsGenderless movement to help spread a message of inclusivity (which went viral and even caught the attention of celebrity makeup artists, like Charlotte Tilbury, and beauty giant L'Or√©al, who signed him as the first U.K. male spokesperson for the brand), he's managed to come up with an acne-covering technique that'll cover your blemishes and leave you with a natural-looking complexion that's flawless AF.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below See! Don't you want your skin to look blemish-free like his?! I do.
All about that festive base! Wishing you all a wonderful Christmas and a Happy New Year! I want to take this opportunity to say a HUGE thank you for the continued love and support you have given to me this year, it really does mean the world üåé üôåüèª #MakeupIsGenderless Prep: Embryolisse Lait-Creme Foundation: @EsteeLauder Double Wear and Bare Minerals original. Concealer: @Lorealmakeup True Match Le Crayon Correcteur Powder: @Rodialskincare InstaGlam Compact Deluxe Translucent HD Bronzer: @BenefitCosmeticsUK Hoola Highlight: @anastasiabeverlyhills Banana Powder (Within the original contour kit) to brighten under-eyes, centre of the forehead, centre of the nose and above cheekbones. Contour: @iconic.london Powder Contour to add soft dimension to the face. Eyebrows: @traciegiles_official to fill in sparse areas, @anastasiabeverlyhills brow definer (in shade taupe) - this allows me to make my brows appear much thicker than they naturally are. To set and hold in place, I used the @anastasiabeverlyhills clear brow gel. Tools: @RealTechniques Miracle Complexion Sponge @MorpheBrushes R2 Brush @CTilburyMakeup Powder & Sculpt Brush @iconic.london Fluffy Tapered Brush @RealTechniques Powder Brush @LauraMercier Secret Camouflage Brush
